content:
• Monday, December 3, 2018
  • RH

    APA, CRUS and RH among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: RH +20.2%. AMS +8.0%. SMAR +7.7%. LOMA +3.9%. SPWH +3.3%.
    • Losers: OSBC -9.9%. CRUS -4.3%. APA -3.5%.TLND -2.6%. LSCC -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • MOMO

    Momo draws short pitch at Kase conference

    • J Capital warns of "circular revenues" in a short pitch for Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) at the Kase Learning Short-Selling Conference.
    • Anne Stevenson-Yang says the company exemplifies "virtual revenues" in China, noting much of the strong revenue growth is driven by customers who pay the company but get some 75%-100% of the cash back -- an approach she notes could be used for money laundering. The firm estimates that aspect could affect some 40% of revenues.
    • Meanwhile the company is painting a picture of growing monthly active users and growth potential, whereas J Capital says MAUs peaked a year ago and the company faces a crowded industry along with high political risk and massive insider selling.
    • Management has turned over (three top members resigned for personal reasons on the same day in November 2017), and a tightening of the money supply in 2019 could prove a negative catalyst as it did in 2009-2010 (a year that took out gaming companies like Giant Interactive, Perfect World, The9 and Shanda).
    • The firm sees 41% downside, to $18.62; shares rose 5.5% today to reach $33.08. They're down 0.2% after hours.
    • #KaseLearning
    • Previously: Momo moves call due to Wednesday market closing (Dec. 03 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 39 Comments
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic -6% on guidance cut

    • Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) drops 6% aftermarket on lowering its Q3 revenue guidance to between $300M and $340M (was: $360M to $400M) due to weakness in the smartphone market.
    • Cirrus' guidance cut follows those of fellow Apple suppliers Lumentum and Qorvo, who were among several names cutting forecasts last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • UDR

    UDR slips 1.2% after announcing stock offering

    • UDR (NYSE:UDR) slumps 1.2% in after-hours trading after agreeing to sell 7.15M shares of common stock in a public offering.
    • Plans to use proceeds for planned acquisitions of assets, working capital, and general corporate purposes.
    • Previously: UDR FFO in-line, beats on revenue (Oct. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • SMAR

    Smartsheet +2.9% on Q3 beats, upside guide

    • Smartsheet (NYSE:SMAR) gains 2.9% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 60% Y/Y revenue growth. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $49M to $50M (consensus: $45.67M) and EPS from -$0.15 to -$0.13 (consensus: -$0.17).
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription, $41.5M; Professional services, $5.3M.
    • Customers: Total was 77,893 at the end of the quarter compared to 76,693 at the end of Q2. The number of customers with ACV at $50K or more was up from 298 to 360. Average ACVs per domain-based customer was up to $2,214 from $2,002.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Smartsheet beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Dec. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRAC

    Keane Group announces 5.25M-share secondary offering

    • Keane Group (NYSE:FRAC) -5.4% after-hours on news of a secondary offering by shareholder Keane Investor Holdings of ~5.25M common shares, of which FRAC plans to repurchase 520K shares from the underwriter.
    • All proceeds from the offering will be distributed to Trican Well Service, after which Trican (OTCPK:TOLWF) will no longer hold equity interests in Keane Investor Holdings.
    • FRAC will not receive any proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • COUP

    Coupa Software reports Q3 beats, upside guide

    • Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP) reports Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with $0.08 and $67.46M (+43% Y/Y), respectively. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $67.8M to $68.3M (consensus: $64.1M) and EPS of about breakeven compared to the -$0.09 consensus.
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription service, $60.6M (consensus $57.1M); Professional services, $6.9M (consensus $5.5M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Coupa shares are up 0.3% aftermarket and closed today up 6.8%.
    • Previously: Coupa Software beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Dec. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ABBV

    Momenta Pharma to delap filing U.S. marketing application for Humira biosimilar; shares down 1% after hours

    • Citing its recent license deal with AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV) that allows it to launch its Humira biosimilar M923 in the U.S. as early as November 20, 2023, Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) will delay filing its marketing application in order to conserve resources. It says the action will not delay its planned market entry in 2023.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • RH

    RH +12% after strong Q4, guidance lift

    • RH (NYSE:RH) is up 12% in AH trading after a sizable Q3 earnings beat. Shares were up 6.5% during the regular session.
    • The retailer reported an operating margin improvement of 220 bps to 10.3% of sales. RH's gross margin also topped estimates.
    • Comparable brand revenue was up 4% during the quarter.
    • RH lifts Q4 revenue guidance to a range of $680M to $690M vs. $665M to $685M prior and EPS of $2.75 to $2.90 vs. prior of guidance $2.33 to $2.54 and $2.50 consensus.
    • Previously: RH beats by $0.46, beats on revenue (Dec. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 6 Comments
  • TTWO

    BofA reiterates 51% upside for TTWO, saying fears are overblown

    • BofA Merrill Lynch is sticking with its bullishness on Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO), saying worries about monetizing its latest flagship release, Red Dead Redemption 2, are overblown.
    • Analyst Justin Post points to a familiar and lucrative example as a model: The company took 18 months for its Grand Theft Auto Online, now a reliable revenue generator, to "get right."
    • RDR 2 is just in beta, and though "there have been issues on online game mechanics and rewards raised in the press," it will be improved, he notes; there's no genre-specific reasons why the western game can't monetize as well as Grand Theft Auto V.
    • He reiterated a target of $156 for shares; after a 5.7% decline today, that implies 51% upside.
    • Previously: Videogame sales rise 24% in Q3 summary look (Nov. 30 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 12 Comments

  • XOM

    U.S. crude finishes +4% on trade truce, anticipated supply cuts

    • Oil prices soared today after the U.S. and China agreed to a 90-day truce in their trade dispute, Canada’s Alberta province ordered a production cut to ease a glut, and OPEC looks set to reduce supply: U.S. WTI settled +4% to $52.95/bbl, and Brent +3.7% to $61.69/bbl.
    • OPEC meets on Thursday to decide production levels, and the group plus Russia is expected to announce cuts aimed at reining in a glut that has pulled down crude prices by around a third since October.
    • "We feel that a decline of about 1.1M-1.2M bbl/day will be required if fresh price lows are to be precluded," says Jim Ritterbusch, president of Ritterbusch and Associates.
    • Among select tickers: XOM +2.1%, CVX +1.6%, RDS.B +2.7%, BP +1.8%, COP +4.1%, PXD +3.5%, EOG +4.5%, DVN +6.1%, APA +3.8%, APC +4.5%, MRO +4.7%, HES +4.4%, NBL +4.9%, SLB +2.4%, HAL +3.7%, BHGE +1.4%, KMI +1.3%, EPD +2.7%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 35 Comments

  • Averages up more than 1% just ahead of close

    • Big early gains were quickly pared back, but the averages are rallying anew in late afternoon action. Fifteen minutes ahead of the close the Dow and S&P 500 are up just over 1%, and the Nasdaq nearly 1.5%.
    • Bonds aren't buying the turnaround in market fortunes - the 10-year Treasury yield is down a fraction at 2.98%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 9 Comments
  • ENPH

    Solar names rise as inverters from China to be spared 25% tariffs

    • The solar sector enjoys heady gains after the U.S. and China agreed to a trade truce while they negotiate difficult issues over the next 90 days, with tariffs on $200B worth of products made in China held at 10%.
    • The 90-day period could prove critical for some manufacturers such as Enphase Energy (ENPH +6.2%), which makes inverters in China and are in the process of shifting production to new locations, PV Magazine says; ENPH has said its contract manufacturing partner Flex will begin producing microinverters in Mexico during Q2 2019.
    • Separately, First Solar (FSLR +4.6%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell with a $46 price target, raised from $39, at Goldman Sachs, which says the stock's recent weakness creates a more favorable risk/reward profile and calls FSLR's 2019 guidance a potential "tactical catalyst" for upward revisions to consensus estimates.
    • Also: CSIQ +2.9%, JKS +2.8%, SPWR +1.1%, SEDG +1.4%, VSLR +1.9%, RUN +1.6%, DQ +0.9%, OTCPK:YGEHY +36%.
    • ETF: TAN
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 29 Comments
  • ACN

    Accenture acquires oil and gas consulting firm

    • Accenture (ACN +1.5%) acquires Enaxis Consulting for undisclosed terms.
    • Enaxis Consulting is a Houston-based management consulting firm experienced in digital capabilities, data science and agile project delivery focusing on the oil and gas and oilfield services sectors and the airline industry. 
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • ESTC

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 PM

    • Gainers: Elastic N.V. (NYSE:ESTC) +14%. SITO Mobile (NASDAQ:SITO) +14%. Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) +10%. Net Element (NASDAQ:NETE) +9%. Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) +8%.
    • Losers: Borqs Technologies (NASDAQ:BRQS) -28%. Arlo Technologies (NYSE:ARLO) -19%. UTStarcom Holdings (NASDAQ:UTSI) -16%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) -14%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -10%.

  • MO

    Deal talks flying in beverage-cannabis-tobacco realm

    • There's a lot of discussions going on between both beverage and tobacco giants with cannabis players, according to Financial Times.
    • Following up on news from earlier today that Altria (MO +1.4%) is in early talks about a takeover of Cronos Group (CRON +10.7%), FT says  Coca-Cola (KO -1.9%) has held talks with Canada’s Aurora Cannabis (ACB +0.5%) to develop beverages and Diageo (DEO -0.1%) is sniffing around the sector.
    • FT also tips that Altria has held talks with Tilray (TLRY +0.9%) and Aphria (APHA -23.4%) in addition to the Cronos interest.
    • Constellation Brands (STZ +0.4%) started off the beverage-cannabis wave earlier this year when it invested just under $4B in Canopy Growth (CGC +0.1%).
    • Previously: Cronos pops on report of Altria interest (Dec. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 95 Comments
  • LNG

    Report: Vessel arrives at Cheniere's Corpus Christi LNG plant

    • A liquefied natural gas vessel, the Maria Energy, reportedly arrived at Cheniere Energy's (LNG +3.3%) $15B Corpus Christi LNG export facility in Texas over the weekend.
    • The vessel is the second to visit Corpus since Cheniere started producing LNG last month at the plant's first liquefaction train and could become the first vessel to pick up a cargo there.
    • It is not known why the first vessel, LNG Golar Tundra, visited Corpus but the company said it did not pick up LNG.
    • The company has said it expects Corpus 1 and the fifth liquefaction train at its Sabine Pass terminal in Louisiana to enter commercial service in Q1 2019, followed by Corpus 2 in H2 2019 and Corpus 3 in H2 2021.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 12 Comments
  • CUB

    Cubic -1% on Needham target trim

    • Needham maintains a Buy rating on Cubic (NYSE:CUB) and lowers the target from $80 to $77.
    • Analyst James Ricchiuti cites the recent equity offering of 3.3M shares or 3.8M if over-allotment is exercised, which is expected to result in about $228M in proceeds. The firm thinks Cubic will earmark that money for debt reduction.
    • Cubic shares are down 1.1% to $60.51.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • EPAY

    Stephens trims Bottomline target

    • Stephens maintains an Equal Weight rating on Bottomline Technologies (NASDAQ:EPAY) but lowers the target by a dollar to $64.
    • Analyst Brett Huff thinks Bottomline was unfairly punished with the 20% decline following the recent earnings report. The firm is incrementally interested in the long-term given the underlying stats and lack of guidance risk.
    • EPAY shares are down 2.4% to $53.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • MRVL

    Deutsche Bank lowers its Marvell target

    • Deutsche Bank maintains a Buy rating on Marvell Tech (NASDAQ:MRVL) but lowers its price target from $25 to $22.
    • Marvell is among the semi names gaining today on news of a US-China trade truce. MRVL shares are up 1.6% to $16.37 today, down 22% in the past quarter, and down 25% YTD.

    Lilis Energy and Laredo Petroleum among Energy/Materials gainers; Ferrellgas Partners and Ultra Petroleum among losers

    • Gainers: Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) +15%. Laredo Petroleum (NYSE:LPI) +14%. Pacific Coast Oil Trust (NYSE:ROYT) +14%. Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) +11%. Crescent Point Energy (NYSE:CPG) +10%.

  • MU

    Mizuho: Buy Micron, Broadcom on trade truce

    • Mizuho semiconductor analyst Vijay Rakesh recommends buying Micron (MU +3.1%), ON Semiconductor (ON +1.5%), Cypress Semi (CY +1.7%), and Broadcom (AVGO +2.1%) on the temporary US-China trade war truce.
    • Rakesh: "We are buyers of AVGO, ON, CY, and MU, which have all been disproportionately hit with tariff concerns and worries of limited 1Q19 visibility. We believe these should resolve N-T."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 64 Comments
  • APLS

    Apellis Pharma up 16% on positive APL-2 data

    • Thinly traded Apellis Pharmaceuticals (APLS +16.4%) is up on more than 30% higher volume, albeit on turnover of only 343K shares, on the heels of its announcement of new data from its open-label Phase 2 PLAUDIT study evaluating complement C3 inhibitor APL-2 in patients with autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA), including cold agglutinin disease (CAD), and warm antibody autoimmune hemolytic anemia (wAIHA). The results were presented at ASH in San Diego.
    • In CAD patients receiving APL-2, average hemoglobin increased from 8.7 g/dL at baseline to 12.1 g/dL at day 56 (normal range for women is 12.0 - 15.5 g/dL, a bit higher for men). Mean absolute count of immature red blood cells called reticulocytes dropped to a level indicating sustained clinical benefit.
    • In wAIHA patients, average hemoglobin increased from 9.3 g/dL at baseline to 11.3 g/dL at day 56. Mean absolute reticulocyte count dropped to a level indicating sustained clinical benefit (drop not as significant as in CAD patients).
    • CAD is a rare severe autoimmune disorder in which IgM antibodies react with red blood cells below 30 degrees Celsius (86 degrees Fahrenheit), causing agglutination that leads to the destruction of red blood cells.
    • Warm AIHA is a rare autoimmune disorder in which IgG antibodies react with red blood cells leading to their destruction at normal body temperature (37 degrees Celsius or 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit).
    • Previously: Apellis Pharma down 17% on hiccup in late-stage study of APL-2 (Oct. 18)
    • #ASH18
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • GM

    Kudlow teases end of EV subsidies

    • White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow told reporters that the White House is planning to get rid of electric car subsidies and other Obama-era auto subsidies, according to Bloomberg.
    • Kudlow's statement was in response to if General Motors (GM +1.8%) would be subject to subsidy action from the government on its own.
    • The EV subsidies could be phased out as early as 2020 or 2021, noted Kudlow.
    • Tesla (TSLA +2.1%) has moved lower from its trading level earlier in the day after the Kudlow statement.
    • Auto stocks: Nissan (OTCPK:NSANY +1%), Ford (F +2.6%), Honda (HMC +1.9%), Toyota (TM +1.6%), Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCAU +3.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 390 Comments
  • ATVI

    Fanatics becomes retail partner of Overwatch League

    • Major sports licensing retailer Fanatics is making its first foray into esports merchandising, via a deal to become the official retail partner of the Overwatch League (ATVI -4%).
    • That means an omnichannel retail experience and a significantly expanded assortment of products, according to the companies.
    • Fanatics will set up a new e-commerce/mobile shopping platform and provide on-site retail for all league events. It includes global rights to Overwatch League jerseys, fan gear, headwear and hard goods sold across all retail and wholesale channels.
    • The 2019 Overwatch League season kicks off Feb. 14.
    • ETF: ESPO +1.3%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 15 Comments
  • BFFI

    Ben Franklin Financial +4.1% after activist speaks up

    • Thinly traded microcap Ben Franklin Financial (OTCQB:BFFI) jumps 4.1% after Stilwell Group says it's planning to launch a proxy contest to get a seat on its board.
    • "The Stilwell Group believes that, due to a prolonged lack of profitability, BFFI has a duty to evaluate all strategic alternatives to maximize shareholder value," the activist investor says.
    • Some 2,516 shares traded hands in early afternoon trading, more than four times its three-month average daily volume of 593.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • NPSNY

    Naspers +4% after solid e-commerce gains, rise at Tencent

    • Naspers ADRs (OTCPK:NPSNY) are up 4% in U.S. trading after its first-half results, and alongside a boost at affiliate Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY), up 4.3% itself amid a temporary thaw in the U.S.-China trade war.
    • Revenues overall grew 29% in rand terms, to about $11B.
    • Meanwhile, trading profit was up 34% to $2B, and core headline earnings rose 39%.
    • The e-commerce units made strong profit contributions, CEO Bob Van Dijk said, thanks in large part to strong contributions from classifieds turning profitable, as well as from the business-to-consumer segment.
    • Internal annual rate of return on the company's flipping its Flipkart stake to Walmart (for $2.2B) was about 29%.
    • Meanwhile, plans to list its video entertainment business will unlock value as "in future, effectively 100% of our revenues and profits will come from online businesses," Van Dijk says.
    • Free cash flow was a positive $271M, vs. an outflow of $96M in the same period a year ago.
    • Naspers owns 31% of Tencent.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • BID

    Sotheby's to split COO position

    • Sotheby's (BID +3.3%) announces the appointment of John Cahill to the role of chief commercial officer and Ken Citron to the position of chief transformation officer.
    • Cahill joins Sotheby's from his eponymous firm, Cahill Cossu Noh & Robinson, while Citron recently spent five years at Christie's as COO.
    • The companys says the two new positions assume the previous role of Sotheby's COO held by Adam Chinn, who will be leaving the company at the end of the year
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • KPTI

    Karyopharm up 5% on selinexor data

    • Karyopharm Therapeutics (KPTI +4.8%) is up on 50% higher volume on the heels of updated data on selinexor in multiple myeloma (MM). The results were presented at ASH in San Diego.
    • In the Phase 1b/2 STORM study evaluating selinexor + dexamethasone, combined with standard-of-care treatment with Pomalyst (pomalidomide) or Darzalex (daratumumab), in heavily pretreated MM patients, the overall response response rate (ORR) was 26.2% (n=32/122), including two complete responders, both minimal residual disease-negative (less likely to relapse). The disease control rate (responders + stable cancer) was 78.7% (n=96/122). Median overall survival (OS) was 8.6 months.
    • In the Phase 1b/2 STOMP study, the arm evaluating selinexor, combined with Darzalex and low-dose dexamethasone, in treatment-resistant MM patients who had received at least three prior lines of therapy, showed an ORR of 73% (n=19/26), all partial responders (seven very good partials). In the arm assessing selinexor + Pomalyst + dexamethasone, the ORR was 50% (n=17/34).
    • The company's U.S. marketing application seeking approval for selinexor + low-dose dexamethasone in penta-refractory MM is currently under FDA review with an action date of April 6, 2019.
    • #ASH18
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • VLKPF

    Volkswagen U.S. sales down 8% in November

    Spirit of Texas Bancshares leads financial gainers; PagSeguro Digital and Hexindai among losers

    • Gainers: Spirit of Texas Bancshares (NASDAQ:STXB) +7%. PennyMac Financial Services (NYSE:PFSI) +7%. Safeguard Scientifics (NYSE:SFE) +6%. X Financial (NYSE:XYF) +6%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) +6%.

  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel a short pick at Tilson conference

    • Cracker Barrel Old Country Store (CBRL -1.1%) trades lower after the restaurant stock is mentioned as a short idea by Pinnacle View Capital at the Whitney Tilson short conference.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 7 Comments
  • GBT

    Global Blood's voxelotor shows positive action in late-stage sickle cell study; shares up 56%

    • Global Blood Therapeutics (GBT +55.7%) is up on more than an 8x surge in volume on the heels of positive data from a Phase 3 clinical trial, HOPE, evaluating voxelotor in patients at least 12 years old with sickle cell disease (SCD). The results were presented at ASH in San Diego.
    • The study met the primary endpoint of at least a 1 g/dL increase in hemoglobin from baseline to week 24 compared to placebo. Specifically, 65% of patients receiving 1500 mg of voxelotor and 33% of those receiving 900 mg achieved at least a 1 g/dL increase in hemoglobin versus 10% for placebo. The separation from control was statistically significant for both doses.
    • Patients receiving 1500 mg showed an average hemoglobin level of 10 g/dL at week 24 from a baseline of 8.6 g/dL, a clinically meaningful improvement in anemia.
    • The study is ongoing with an estimated completion date of June 2019.
    • Previously: FDA accepts GBT's proposal for accelerated approval pathway for Voxelotor; shares up 42% premarket (Dec. 3)
    • Previously: Global Blood -7% despite positive data from sickle cell drug trial (June 27)
    • #ASH18
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • NLSN

    Nielsen jumps on report that new CEO proceeds with sale talks

    • Nielsen Holdings (NYSE:NLSN) is up 3.2% and tagged a session high after The Deal says a new CEO isn't crimping sale explorations for the company.
    • New chief David Kenny takes over today, and the report notes that gives potential private-equity suitors a central point of contact.
    • Madison Dearborn is reportedly looking at a bid, and at least six other firms have hired advisers, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM

    Healthcare and Industrial goods dominate midday movers

Osmotica Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OSMT) +15%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) +15%.

    • Facebook (FB +2%) is pursuing a strategy with upstart India wireless provider Reliance Jio to tap fast growth in the world's fastest-growing major Internet market, via inexpensive phones that have come to be known in rural areas as "WhatsApp phones."
    • India has 480M Internet users (75% more than the U.S., and second only to China) but is expected to grow to 737M users by 2022, Forrester Research says.

  • INCY

    Incyte's Jakafi successful in mid-stage GvHD study; shares up 7%

    • A Phase 2 clinical trial, REACH1, evaluating Incyte's (INCY +6.5%) Jakafi (ruxolitinib), combined with corticosteroids, in patients with acute graft-versus-host disease (GvHD) who failed to respond adequately to corticosteroids met the primary endpoint. The results were presented at ASH in San Diego.
    • Specifically, treated patients showed an overall response rate (ORR) of 55% (n=39/71) at day 28. 73% (n=52/71) experienced a response at some point in the study. 68% (n=48/71) had serious or life-threatening GvHD at baseline.
    • The median duration of response in day 28 responders who were followed for at least six months was 345 days.
    • The company's U.S. marketing application is currently under FDA review with an action date of February 24, 2019.
    • The FDA approved Jakafi for myelofibrosis is 2011 and for polycythemia vera in 2014.

  • BHVN

    Biohaven Pharma up 17% on positive data on Zydis in migraine

    • Thinly traded Biohaven Pharmaceutical Holding Company (BHVN +17.1%) is up on more than double normal volume following its announcement of topline data from a Phase 3 clinical trial, BHV3000-303, evaluating lead candidate Zydis orally dissolving tablet formulation of rimegepant for the acute treatment of migraine.
    • The study met the two co-primary endpoints of pain freedom and freedom from the most bothersome symptom at hour 2 with a single dose. The treatment effect was experienced in as little as 15 minutes and the separation from placebo was statistically significant at 60 minutes.
    • Specifically, 21.2% of patients receiving Zydis experienced pain freedom at hour 2 compared to 10.9% for placebo (p<0.0001). 35.1% experienced pain from the most bothersome symptom at hour 2 versus 26.8% for control (p=0.0009).
    • A range of secondary endpoints was achieved as well.
    • The company plans to file its U.S. marketing application in 2019.

  • SNSS

    Sunesis Pharma down 34% on vecabrutinib data

    • Thinly traded nano cap Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (SNSS -33.5%) is down on over four times normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 544K shares, following its announcement of preliminary data from a Phase 1b/2 clinical trial evaluating vecabrutinib, a non-covalent BTK inhibitor, in patients with relapsed/refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and other blood cancers. The results were presented at ASH in San Diego.
    • The data were generated on 11 patients (seven with CLL, two with mantle cell lymphoma and two with Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia) who had received an average of five prior lines of therapy and had progressed on prior covalent BTK inhibitor treatment.
    • No efficacy data were presented. According to interim CEO Dayton Misfeldt, "vecabrutinib has demonstrated both an encouraging safety profile and evidence of pharmacodynamic activity."
    • On the safety front, the most common serious treatment-emergent adverse events were anemia, neutropenia, leukocytosis and ALT (liver enzyme) increase (10% each). One patient experienced a dose-limiting toxicity.

  • SNNA

    Sienna Bio's pegcantratinib flunks mid-stage psoriasis study; shares down 27%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Sienna Biopharmaceuticals (SNNA -27.2%) is down on average volume following its announcement of topline data from a Phase 2b clinical trial evaluating SNA-120 (pegcantratinib) in patients with mild-to-moderate psoriasis with at least moderate pruritis (itchy skin).
    • The study failed to achieve the primary endpoint of the change from baseline to week 8 in a scale of pruritis severity called I-NRS. Specifically, patients treated with SNA-120 experienced a mean 4.3-point reduction in I-NRS compared to a 4.0-point reduction for vehicle (placebo) (p=0.244). The results were similar between the 0.05% and 0.5% strengths.
    • On a positive note, 27% of treated patients achieved a 75% reduction in lesions (PASI 75) compared to 13% for vehicle (p=0.045).
    • No safety signals were observed.
    • A Phase 3 study assessing SNA-120 in psoriasis and a Phase 2 study assessing SNA-125 in atopic dermatitis should launch in H2 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
